entry.title: Use APIM extract variable and then use it in the condition string?
entry.content:
Hello APIM experts...

I am fairly new to APIM and I am trying to extract a variable from JSON input and then use that variable within the API condition strings to send it to the appropriate API path. I have tried looking on the interwebs and have read a bunch of posts and am not having any luck.

Here is my example JSON:

{
  "orderNumber" : "123456789",
...
}

I have tried several variants of the following in my Extract Variables policy:

I want to extract orderNumber into a variable and then if that orderNumber matches a pattern, I want to send it to the Proxy Endpoint in/DEVcreateorder and if it matches a different pattern, I want to send it to in/TESTcreateorder.

So my questions would be:

  1. Is this possible?
  2. If possible, how to extract that value into a variable I can use in the condition string within APIM?

Like I said, I have read and tried things I have read to no avail at even extracting the variable yet. Any help is appreciated!

Thanks for taking the time!

Neal

entry.title: Re: Passing a LIST between Automations
entry.content:
Hi, JesseThibodeau.

You can use a List with parameters created with Any type. The Any type means an Object, including an Array of Objects. When you use the Any type you lost the structure reference for autocomplete. But you can do a LOOP and get the value an specific field. If you try to use a field with wrong name or no exists, on execution result an error.

The other way is create a Data Type with your specific fields and mark it like a List. And when you create the automation parameter select the Data Type created. The bad thing, inside the Workflow Process, you have to mapping all the corresponding fields.

entry.title: Debugging ABAP on BW4Hana does not work
entry.content:
Hey Specs,

I've an issue regarding jumping into debugging with BW4Hana.

I was creating breakpoint in the ABAP routines.
But if I run it in simulate or normal mode the running does not stops at breakpoint.

I was figuring maybe the problem that on BW4Hana there are seperate classes for the Modified and the Active class for implementing the same transformation logic, but in this case in production I see no other implementation then only the active.

The only way to stop the transformation is to pick a break point in the dtp.

entry.title: Addition to existing stock prevented by source HU-type if not allowed in destination storage type
entry.content:
Hello experts,

during processing of inbound customer returns, we pack the receiving products in plastic bins (1 bin per Product/Batch). The warehouse tasks are created for these HUs with the intention of adding these products to existing stock when possible (without the plastic bin), otherwise an empty storage bin should be targeted (with plastic bin). We use addition to existing stock based on weight/volume, we don't use dimensionless capacities.

The issue we face is, that possible target bins for addition to existing stock are ignored by the system when the HU type of the plastic bin (source HU) is not allowed in that particular storage type for final putaway (although the products are removed from the source HU before adding to the existing destination HU.

I tried several settings in warehouse process type and in the storage type with the intention that the system ignores the source HU-type when using addition to existing stock but did not succeed so far.

Is it somehow possible to configure that the source HU is not considered in putaway when using addition to existing stock and is only considered when an empty bin is found?

Thanks and best regards! WPT and Storage type settings attached.

entry.title: Re: Joule for Developers vs Joule for Consultants - Under...
entry.content:
Hi,

Joule for developers helps for ABAP. Means the model is trained on ABAP lines. It is integral part of the modeling tools. 

Joule for consultants is a complete new LLM. Separate instance. Separate tool. Excellent for SAP proprietary content search. 

Martin

entry.title: InnerSource Summit 2025
entry.content:
InnerSource is the practice of applying Open Source methodologies, culture and best practices to in-house software development.
SAP is honored to co-host this year's InnerSource Summit, an hybrid across-the-world event, where practitioners and interested parties come together to learn, share, expand their networks and recharge their InnerSource batteries.

Join the event to learn more about how the practice is adopted by different companies and to connect with industry peers who are also interested in or working with InnerSource.

If you can't join onsite in Berlin, join us virtually or in Yokohama and New York, where the event is co-hosted by Mitsubishi Electric and IBM.

Please register for the event via this link: https://innersourcecommons.org/events/isc-2025/

entry.title: Re: Preparation Cerification SAC
entry.content:
Hi @rouchad_abderrazak1042 - Welcome to world of SAC ü§ó

I will be having the certification exam in mind; sometimes there are more ways to do it, but I will give - what I think - is the correct answer. 

Q1: You have a dimension with members for product groups and products. Each product group has associated products. You want to plan by product group without disaggregating into the products.

How can you do this?

Disable allocations
Use two properties
Disable distribution
Use two hierarchies

A1:  Make two hierarchies, one where you have the product categories as leaf members, and do the planning on that hierarchy, then there will be no disaggregation and another hierarchy with products as leaf members. 

Further elaboration / Info: 
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/1679129715024574b7bbb4a611471765.html?locale=en-US

_______________________________________________________________________________________________ 

Q2: You are creating a new public version. Which categories can you use?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Forecast
Budget
Predictive
Actual

A2: The correct answer is "Budget" and "Forecast". I think the predictive version, needs to be "generated" (e.g trained) by using the "predictive Scenarios" app in SAC. From a business perspective, at least for me, it does not really make sense to "create" actuals, I think they should always come from a "source" (ECC, S4 etc.)

Not to confuse too much, but if you are in the "modeler", you can also make "Actuals", which I guess is not "Actual" üòÖ. 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________  Q3: You are creating a script for an advanced data action. Which character designates a virtual variable member?

 

%
/
#
.

A3: Virtual variable member(s) are designated by using the "#". You use %parameter% for parameters in SAC. By using two "//" you can comment, using @ for variables (not virtual) - and a "." is simply a dot üòÑ

_______________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Q4: You have a story in My Files. You want your colleague to review and comment on the story. What must you do?

Create a Review task for the story
Add a Comment widget to the story
Include the story in a Discussion
Share with View access

A4: What should be noted here is that the story is in "My Files" - and this is also why I don't like any of the answersüòÖ, I think it should be transferred out of my files as a first step, given this is a personal folder.  

So instead, I will try using the method of "what I don't think it is".
I do not think it is the "Add comment widget", because this will not establish a "good" review process, neither will "Share with View Access". By including the story as an attachment and creating a in a discussion you might get half the way, BUT I think the correct answer here is "Create a Review task for the story", given that it will both allow for a governed review process and commenting on the story.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q5: What can you do to reduce the data refresh time when opening a story? Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Avoid tables with more than 500 rows and 60 columns
Load widgets in the background
Avoid prompts
Use responsive pages
Use conditional formatting

A5: Avoid large tables, make widget(s) load in the background, using prompts can be beneficial so we should definitely not avoid them, conditional formatting puts "extra" processing time on the front layer (SAC has 3 layers; backend, network and frontend) and responsive pages should render faster than canvas - I have not  personally experience a big difference here. 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q6:You have a live data model with two dimensions: Firstname and Lastname. Users want a single dimension in the data model that displays the dimensions as Lastname, Firstname.

What must you do?

Create the combined data in the source system data model.
Create a calculated dimension in the story.
Create a dimension in the live data model.
Group the Firstname and Lastname in the data model.

A6: Another one of those questions üòÖ. I will always correct it in the backend (for reusable aspects, performance etc.) , but it is possible to create a calculated dimension in SAC. Below I simply calculated a new Dimension by adding Sales manager + Location.  When we are on "live connection" there is not much (if any) you can do on the model in SAC, so we cannot create a dimension in the live data model. Also, group Firstname and LastName in the data model is also a "no-no senor".

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q7: You have a story based on an import model. The transaction data in the model's data source changes.

How can you update the data in the model?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

Refresh the import job
Schedule the import
Allow model import
Refresh the story

A7: When we have an import or acquired model,  nothing will happen in SAC when the source data changes per default unless we have set up an import job in the calendar or by manual refreshing the import job.   

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q8: You have a dataset that extracts data from an SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) system. The data in the SAP BW system changes. How can you update the dataset?

You must refresh the story that uses the dataset.
You must manually reimport the data.
You can schedule the dataset to update on a regular basis.
You must create a new dataset.

A8: I am not strong on datasets. But I just opened one, and you can  reimport it manually from either local system or file server.  

 

 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q9: Which SAP Analytics Cloud feature uses natural language processing?

Smart insight
Data analyzer
Digital boardroom
Just Ask feature

A9: The Just Ask feature; you can ask "questions" to specific (index) model, I have not used it for a long time, but back then they needed to be "indexed". The Data Analyzer is for exploration of data (resembles Pivot in Excel), Digital Boardroom is being outfaced and more a "presentation feature" and "Smart insights" is more of an augmented/statistical analytics feature.

Info:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/c9eb30cc1e5b4c439cb871bf9612d2ac.html?locale=en-US 

_______________________________________________________________________________________________

Q10:  Which automatically created dimension type can you delete from an analytic data model?

Date
Generic
Version
Organization

A10: Note, we have two type of models in SAC : Analytical - and Planning Model.  When you create a model in SAC; the automatically generate dimensions are: Date and Version. 

For Planning models, you will NEED a version dimension - the system allows you to delete it, but you will get an error afterwards. But you can delete "Date" (but note, that a planning model needs at least one dimension other than version).
For an Analytical model, you will also need a version dimension, but you can delete "Date", and the model does not need at least one other dimension than version. 

I hope it helps you on you SAC journey! üòä 

Kind regards,
Dani

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 Speakers' Series: Special SAP Community Moments
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

My name is Moshe Naveh from the SAP community team. It‚Äôs this time of the year when SAP community members come together. Those attending SAP TechEd in person and virtually add another dimension to their online community friendships and bonding. I feel it‚Äôs like our virtual family reunion and everyone share where they are at in their life and SAP Community journey.

Therefore, in this blog post I will share about my own community journey that started back in 2009 and still happily continues these days:

  1. My Special SAP Community moments and initiatives
  2. SAP Community members' SAP TechEd sessions
  3. Share your SAP Community special moments, first and recent post and cool picture

Why I wear these ears:) :

My special ears on to show tribute to the Blog It Forward series during SAP TechEd Berlin 2014

 

 My Special SAP Community Moments

1) Community challenges/initiatives 

The community challenges are a great opportunity to get to know other SAP Community members. What they are passionate about, the amazing people they are, places they have been to and more.

Here are some challenges/initiative I ran since I joined the community and gave me great joy:

Blog forward, What do you do?, SAP Sapphire speaker series and the most recent one, our hobbies series. It is so much fun getting to know how creative, diligent, sportive our SAP Community members are:

Featuring of the Hobbies series

  2) My first SAP Inside Track

Back in 2013 I organized the first SAP Inside Track in Israel. We had over than 100 SAP Community members from 40 different companies. The event included 23 sessions, each lasting 15 minutes (which was then innovative). 

Audience at SAP Inside Track 2013 Israel

Organizing the event was a complex project: 

  • Identifying the right speakers and working with them to optimize their presentations
  • Inviting and following up with the attendees 
  • Working on all the required logistics: Catering, venue, sound and IT systems and much more

It was so much fun and our dear community members had an amazing time.

3) SAP TechEd events

My first SAP TechEd was in SAP TechEd Bangalore- 2012. I had so much fun! It was my first time in India as well. I was amazed by so many things: the event itself and the innovative booths, the great Indian food, beautiful touristic attractions and above all I was so happy to meet the SAP community members from India and other locations. To suddenly talk, shake hands and even dance with my online friends was a great pleasure. We also had a gathering of the Blog it forward participants and we all celebrated together 10 years of SAP community. 

Jitendra Kansal and I, in SAP TechEd Bangalore 2012

The following SAP TechEd events I attended continued to be unforgettable experiences. Each SAP TechEd event offered it‚Äôs own unique spirit and cool SAP Community activities

I'm broadcasting from the SAP TechEd Berlin 2017

4) Simplified blogging

I‚Äôm very fortunate that after almost 16 years as an SAP Community advocate, I‚Äôm still passionate about what I do. One of things I most passionate is to support our dear SAP Community members to make the most out of their SAP Community experience. This is what led me to establish the simplified blogging methodology. 

The idea behind this method is that by using AI tools and predefined templates per event, SAP Community members can reduce the time it takes them to blog by up to 75%. The method was initially trialed at the SAP Sapphire speakers‚Äô series and received positive feedback from the authors/speakers. By keeping our AI guidelines and keep the content unique and with your own voice, you can dramatically reduce the time it takes you to blog. 

Simplified blogging methodology was used in smaller events but also in our current SAP Sapphire speakers series (and the recap series where the AI tools usage was introduced). The most recent usage of the simplified blogging methodology is the SAP TechEd Berlin speakers 2025 series which I would like to share with you today. 

Every session by an SAP Community member is a special SAP Community moment. It is where everyone can connect and share knowledge, which is also what our SAP Community is about. In this series our remarkable SAP Community members who speak at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025, shared what they are going to present about. They also invite you to engage and network with them before the event via multiple interesting questions:

 

Title

Author

Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

@sunny_kapoor 

Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action

@stephaniejerch 

Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM:

@soeren_ruder 

From insight to action to agents: SAP Signavio roadmap session

@hoangvu 

AI agent hub: how to discover and control all your AI agents

@Michelle10 

Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

@matthiasstegmue 

Mastering zero trust: SAP Customer Identity and Access Management

@rakefetga20 

Analyze and optimize front-end application performance

@Joaquin_RecioHuertas 

SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance

@AndreasSeifried 

Production Readiness Isn't Optional: A Practical Look at XP265

@thorsten_sandfuchs 

Where‚Äôs Waldo ‚Ä¶ ah ‚Ä¶ Terraform?

@lechnerc77 

Enabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code

@shraddhashetty 

SAP HANA Cloud - Advisors and automation

@jinheejeong 

 Transitioning from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM

@a_schulze 

 

 

Recently @AnnePetteroe  introduced guidelines for content created with generative AI. They enable even more straight forward and optimal method and guidelines for when using AI tools to create content in the SAP Community.

Like always, SAP TechEd is going to be filled with lots of great SAP activities and opportunities! Read more about it in @josh_bentley  blog post.

I really look forward to meeting many great SAP community friends and making new onesüôÇ. Come and visit us in the SAP community booth! Come and take a profile picture, chat, ask questions, share ideas and whatever you feel likeüôÇ.

Now, before ending this post, I would like to invite you to share in the comments (you can answer one or more questions):

  • When did you join the SAP community?
  • What is your first/most special memory of the community?
  • Link to your first and most recent posts

 If you have a picture or a video to add as well as tag others, that would be amazing!

Looking forward to reading all about your special SAP Community moments!

entry.title: Empowering Process Visibility with Step Navigation Links
entry.content:
Introduction

In the world of process automation and monitoring, visibility is power‚Äîbut actionability is the real game-changer. That‚Äôs why SAP Process Visibility offers a powerful feature that lets you go beyond viewing process steps to actually interacting with them: Step Navigation Links.

With just one click, users can jump directly from a step in the Process Workspace to the relevant task in the source application [Eg., My Inbox, SAP Task Center etc.,] streamlining issue resolution, approvals, and decision-making.

Let‚Äôs explore how easy it is to set this up.

 

What Are Step Navigation Links?

Step navigation links allow you to embed deep links in specific steps of a process path so users can quickly navigate to external apps like My Inbox, SAP Task Center, or any custom application to take action or see more details.

This bridges the gap between process monitoring and process execution.

 

Real-World Example

Imagine you're tracking a Capital Expenditure Approval process in SAP Process Visibility. One of the steps is a pending task that a manager needs to approve in My Inbox.

With Step Navigation Links, you can:

  • Display a clickable link right on the process step in the Process Path view.
  • Direct users to the exact task instance in 'My Inbox'.
  • Eliminate the need for users to search manually or switch between systems.

 

How to Configure Step Navigation Links

A quick step-by-step guide to configure step navigation links in your visibility scenario can be found in our SAP Help Documentation : Configure Step Navigation Links.

 

Example: Deep Linking to My Inbox

Steps:

  • In the visibility scenario editor, navigate to the Processes tab and choose the SAP Build Process Automation process for which you want to configure step navigation link.
  • Under Steps and Events section, select the required step from the list and choose ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù.

  • In the Edit Step dialog box, navigate to the Link tab, and enable the Enable Link Configurations toggle button to configure the navigation link and update the Event, Path and Link Text as shown in the below example.

Here‚Äôs a practical example of how to create a dynamic link:

Copy the Original URL from 'My Inbox':

In the copied URL, replace the InstanceID with {stepInstanceId}, which will be dynamically retrieved from Process Visibility

Final URL:

This ensures that the link dynamically pulls the correct step instance ID when viewed in Process Visibility.

 

Why This Matters

Step Navigation Links bring real-time actionability to your process monitoring tools. Instead of just seeing that something is pending, users can click directly into the task, speeding up response times and improving collaboration across teams.

They‚Äôre especially valuable in scenarios like:

  • Procurement Approvals
  • HR Workflows
  • (Or) Any custom business process.

 

Final Thoughts

Configuring Step Navigation Links in SAP Process Visibility enables a dynamic, interactive experience. Whether you're managing tasks in My Inbox, SAP Task Center, or custom apps, these deep links let you act without leaving your process dashboard.

It‚Äôs a small setup with big impact‚Äîboosting productivity, responsiveness, and user satisfaction.

entry.title: Re: What kind of purchase with SAP to get C# .NET connector
entry.content: Connector SDKs like NCo run on the client host. No additional software is required on server side. Hence, I don't think that NCo would be included in any AS ABAP server installation package. You can download NCo separately from https://support.sap.com/nco if your company has the required download permission.

entry.title: How to Read Change Document in MDG Mass Processing
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I am looking for some solution to read change document for plant in Mass Processing MDG because in Mass process based on 1 CR no we have multiple Material with multiple plant.
So how can i fetch which material is linked to which plant?

from code how we can fetch data for mass because in here we have importing parameter CR number only :- 

lo_usmd_chg_doc->read_document_lines(
EXPORTING is_document_header = ls_doc_hdr
io_model = lo_if_model
IMPORTING et_changed_value = lt_cg_doc_vals
et_changed_detail = lt_cg_doc_details ).

Because in lt_cg_doc vals the output for mass process is be like 1st row contain FIELD NAME - MATERIAL & VALUE - MATERIAL NO
2nd ROW contain FIELD NAME - WERKS & VALUE - WERKS NO
So how we can linked 2 rows with each other 

Or do we have some other solution to find out data from Change Document in MDG which plant got change for which Material.

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

entry.title: Re: BAPI_CONTRACT_CHANGE problem with prices
entry.content:
Solved. It seems that in all our programs, the SERIAL_ID field in the conditions table was being incremented by 1 from the last SERIAL_ID of that item. However, this ID is not unique at the item level, but rather at the entire document level.

So, when the item didn‚Äôt exist yet and several new ones were added, our programs were always setting this SERIAL_ID field to 1, which caused the items not to be created correctly.

The funny thing is that this had been working like that for years with our previous version ‚Äî it only started failing after the upgrade.

entry.title: Re: What kind of purchase with SAP to get C# .NET connector
entry.content:
In this scenario, they don't have any purchases or permissions today and are looking for confirmation of the cheapest option / product to buy that would get them there. To that end, it seems like this thread is saying they'd need to have a sales discussion about buying the least amount of licenses for "on-premises ABAP system, i.e. an old R/3 release or SAP Business Suite 7 (NetWeaver AS ABAP 6.x / 7.x)". 

Wouldn't Cloud Appliance Library, and the trial for it here: https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/cloud-appliance-library.html be the closest to free option to achieve result of being able to access what the connector does without having to purchase a license of an ERP suite?

I'm thinking of the Azure / AWS / Google Cloud costs to run CAL, which would still have to be less than buying the minimum number of licenses on an ABAP suite.

entry.title: U.S SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603
entry.content:
Section 603 introduces a mandatory Roth catch-up contribution requirement for high-earner employees whose prior year FICA wages exceeded the $145,000 threshold. These legal changes have been addressed by the following SAP Notes:

Main Notes:
3365473 - BEN: SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603:  Note from 2023, introduced the initial changes required for complying with Section 603
3617266 - BEN: Section 603 update for catch-up contributions: Addresses the delivery of the automatic Roth rollover option
3619038 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3617266  
3650369 - BEN: Section 603 Rollover Pre-Tax limit check for 401K and 403B plans: Provides the option to include only pre-tax contributions when assessing the FICA limit for employees who are already contributing to a Roth plan.

Correction Notes:
3654911 - Correction to NOTE_3619038 report :  Addresses an issue within Note 3619038, specifically correcting the report that triggers the error "V_T7USBEN03" | "Could not add to transport request" during manual execution steps.
3669878 - BEN: Corrections to SECURE 2.0 Act - Section 603 

USA -  Workzone

Stay Informed and get involved subscribing to the USA ‚Äì SAP Human Capital Management Localization Workzone.

entry.title: Re: Work Around for Comp Rules changing Impurities to Components
entry.content: Hi christoph_bergemann, The issue is one PURE_SUB (for this example this PURE_SUB will be called Pure_Sub A) in one RAW_SUB (for this example this will be called Raw_Sub B). Pure_Sub A is assigned CompType Impurity in CG02 in Exact composition based on product in Raw_Sub B. Raw_Sub B is assigned to a REAL_SUB in CG02 Exact composition based on products. Pure_Sub A only appears in Raw_Sub B as a impurity. Pure_Sub A is not in any other RAW_SUBs. The ZEXP_COMP (comp rule) is executed on the REAL_SUB. The CG02 Standard composition of the REAL_SUB shows Pure_Sub A as a Component. For this example Pure_Sub A only appears once in the Standard composition of the REAL_SUB and only appears in Raw_Sub B no other RAW_SUBs. For Regulatory reasons Pure_Sub A is an impurity in Raw_Sub B and is an impurity in the REAL_SUB. Is there a work around so Pure_Sub A retains CompType Impurity in the REAL_SUB Standard Composition?

entry.title: Fixing the ‚ÄúEINVAL‚Äù Error in SAPUI5 after S/4HANA Upgrade
entry.content:
Post-upgrade, my local UI5 app refused to start - here‚Äôs what happened?

After our backend was upgraded to SAP S/4HANA, I ran into an issue while starting a SAPUI5 app locally: 

npm run start-local

Resulting in: "Command run failed with error spawn EINVAL"

 Screenshot 1.1: Error Message

Note: EINVAL means ‚ÄúInvalid Argument‚Äù, usually caused by outdated tooling or environment mismatches.

 

How I Fixed It

Everything in my project looked correct, but the error persisted. I first verified the Node.js and npm versions to rule out environment or version mismatches.

npm -version
node -v

However, the issue still remained. Eventually, I discovered that the real cause was an outdated UI5 Tooling version, which was no longer fully compatible after the backend upgrade.

 Screenshot 1.2: Version Checks

 

Updating the UI5 Tooling solved the issue in my case: 

npm install -g @ui5/cli

 

 Screenshot 1 .3: Tooling upgrade

then tried to re-run locally: 

npm run start-local

After this, the app started successfully running (no more EINVAL errors)

 

Points to be remembered:

  • Keep UI5 Tooling as well as node.js up to date, especially after backend upgrades like S/4HANA.
  • When you see spawn EINVAL, check your tooling version first, it‚Äôs often the simplest fix.
  • Align your local environment with backend changes to avoid unexpected errors.

Updating the tooling was a small step that saved a lot of debugging time and made the app fully compatible with the new backend.

Thank you for taking the time to read this blog! I hope this helps you improve your commit messages. If you found this helpful, please feel free to share your thoughts, feedback or questions in the comments. Let's keep learning and growing together!

Stay tuned for more Git-related commands in future blogs. Happy coding!

Dear experts, I‚Äôm new to blogging, please feel free to correct me if any information is inaccurate.

entry.title: Guia de assinatura PKCS7 no ABAP (bradesco e etc)
entry.content:
Ol√° comunidade de Joinville, me chamo Lucas B, sou ABAP e tamb√©m sou um dos curadores da comunidade de JLLE, hoje vou partilhar o passo a passo de como trazer a tecnologia de assinatura digital utilizando o padr√£o PKCS#7 com o algoritmo de assinatura com SHA256 pra dentro do nosso ABAP.

Essa tecnologia era, e ainda √© bastante utilizada pelos bancos para garantir a seguran√ßa por meio de certificados. Hoje em dia, a maioria j√° migrou para o mTLS; um desses casos √© o Bradesco.

Alguns podem achar imposs√≠vel, mas com ABAP tudo √© poss√≠vel üòÖ (basta ter tempo e paci√™ncia suficiente)...

Contextualizando um pouco do problema, h√° 2 anos atr√°s est√°vamos portando as APIs do Bradesco pra dentro do SAP, previamente utiliz√°vamos um proxy em Python pra realizar essas comunica√ß√µes via API que acabava sendo a √∫nica op√ß√£o vi√°vel, pois ate ent√£o n√£o t√≠nhamos conhecimento de como realizar a criptografia com PKCS#7 dentro do SAP, na √©poca que fui atr√°s ainda tinha 1 aninho de ABAP, passei um bom tempo at√© acertar üòÜ. Hoje em dia o Bradesco atualizou a infraestrutura das APIs dele e utiliza o padr√£o de mercado, dito isso, n√£o vamos conseguir replicar 100% a chamada na API, mas vamos conseguir gerar o que precisaria se fosse o caso.
Hoje em dia ainda existem bancos que utilizam essa tecnologia ‚úÖ.

Agora vamos por a m√£o na massa, requerimentos:

  • Certificado A1 .pse instalado em uma pastinha na STRUST
  • Client ID / Client Key

Ao ver o manual, o processo segue primeiramente gerando o payload do body de autentica√ß√£o, enviando os campos:

  1. AUD: Endpoint que vamos chamar.
  2. SUB: Client ID / Client Key
  3. IAT: Timestamp de quando o token for criado
  4. EXP: Timestamp de quando o token for expirar
  5. JTI: Timestamp atual em MS
  6. VER: Vers√£o da API (no caso preench√≠amos fixo 1.1 pro Bradesco).

(geramos o payload em cima de uma estrutura, utilizando a classe de JSON standard do ABAP)

Os headers envi√°vamos fixo o seguinte:

{"alg":"RS256","typ":"JWT"}

Dito isso, temos o payload e os headers, os dois em vari√°veis de string codificados em JSON, o manual instru√≠ a gente a codificar ambos em Base64 e depois concatenar o conte√∫do, no final vamos ter uma string com o seguinte:

{headers_base64}.{payload_base64}

Podemos codificar as strings para Base64 utilizando o m√©todo ENCODE_BASE64 da classe CL_HTTP_UTILITY, s√≥ temos que ter um pouco de cuidado que ele acaba codificando para Base64 o conte√∫do vazio restante da mem√≥ria alocada para aquela string, podemos contornar isso fazendo um replace de == na string por vazio, assim removendo o "restinho" que fica do Base64.

Agora que vem a parte legal, tendo o nosso {headers_base64}.{payload_base64} em uma vari√°vel, podemos partir para assinatura com o certificado, e isso vamos tornar poss√≠vel com a nossa querida fun√ß√£o SSF_KRN_SIGN, que fica junto com as fun√ß√µes do SSF muito utilizadas no mundinho de certificados da SAP. Antes de mostrar o passo a passo, vamos entender os par√¢metros da fun√ß√£o:

 importing:
	SSFTOOLKIT - pra ser sincero, acredito que seja meio que a biblioteca que 
				vai usar por debaixo dos panos para realizar a criptografia,
				enviamos fixo SAPSECULIB	
	STR_FORMAT - aqui indicamos qual tipo de PKCS vamos utilizar, por mais que
				vamos utilizar PKCS#7 por algum motivo a funcao representa tal
				tecnologia como 'PKCS1-V1.5'
	B_INC_CERTS - se vamos incluir o certificado dentro da assinatura, nao sei
				dizer o que exatamente faz debaixo dos panos, mas eh necessario 
	B_DETACHED - assinatura digital sem a carga pra assinar, no nosso caso
				vamos enviar ''
	B_INENC - nao sei exatamente o que faz pra ser sincero, descricao do campo diz
			"Code input data or not?", enviamos vazio
	IO_SPEC - deixamos o padrao da funcao 'T', para utilizar as tabelas internas
			enviando como F ele retorna o nosso conteudo desejado via arquivo
	OSTR_INPUT_DATA_L - aqui passamos o tamanho do nosso payload a ser assinado
						lembrando que aqui vamos passar um SOLIX, logo podemos
						pegar o tamanho direto na funcao que converte pra SOLIX
	STR_HASHALG - algoritmo de hash, vamos enviar SHA256, utilizado pelo banco
exporting:
	OSTR_SIGNED_DATA_L - tamanho da assinatura, nao utilizamos
	CRC - codigo de retorno, podemos tratar mas no meu caso os erros possiveis
		sao tratados anteriormente
tables:
	OSTR_INPUT_DATA - payload de input (em solix) que vamos assinar
	SIGNER - dados de quem vai assinar, inclui o certificado que vamos utilizar
	OSTR_SIGNED_DATA - a preciosa assinatura em binario

Dito isso, vamos a constru√ß√£o dos par√¢metros que n√£o √© fixo, come√ßaremos pela tabela SIGNER, essa tabela contem os seguintes campos:

  • ID, preencheremos com o sujeito do certificado.
  • PROFILE, iremos preencher com o nome do arquivo do PSE, caso seja um SSL Client ira seguir o seguinte padr√£o: SAPSSL{codigo_da_pasta}.pse, podemos utilizar outros tipos sem ser o SSL Client, mas tenha em mente que o padr√£o de nome de arquivo varia de um pra outro.
  • PASSWORD, a senha do PSE. (necess√°rio passar a senha porque nesse tipo de assinatura trabalhamos diretamente com a chave privada, ao utilizar o mTLS do cliente HTTP padr√£o do SAP por exemplo, s√≥ passamos o ID da STRUST e o SAP j√° resolve tudo na camada de rede).

Para conseguir o sujeito do certificado dinamicamente podemos utilizar novamente as fun√ß√µes do pacote SSF, utilizando primeiramente a fun√ß√£o SSFC_GET_OWNCERTIFICATE para obter o certificado completo em bin√°rio e depois SSFC_PARSE_CERTIFICATE para decifrar o sujeito do certificado. (tenha em mente que aqui tamb√©m precisamos do nome de arquivo e senha).

call function 'SSFC_GET_OWNCERTIFICATE'
	exporting PROFILE = IV_PSE
			  PROFILEPW = IV_PSEPWD
	importing CERTIFICATE = LV_RAW_CERTIFICATE
	exceptions  SSF_KRN_ERROR = 1
				SSF_KRN_NOMEMORY = 2
				SSF_KRN_NOSSFLIB = 3
				SSF_KRN_INVALID_PAR = 4
				SSF_KRN_NOCERTIFICATE = 5
				others = 6.
				
call function 'SSFC_PARSE_CERTIFICATE'
	exporting CERTIFICATE = LV_RAW_CERTIFICATE
	importing SUBJECT = RV_SUBJECT
	exceptions  SSF_KRN_ERROR = 1
				SSF_KRN_NOMEMORY = 2
				SSF_KRN_NOSSFLIB = 3
				SSF_KRN_INVALID_PAR = 4
				others = 5.

Dito isso, temos a tabela de SIGNER pronta, agora iremos partir pro preenchimento da OSTR_INPUT_DATA e a vari√°vel de input OSTR_INPUT_DATA_L, no meu caso utilizei o m√©todo STRING_TO_SOLIX da classe CL_BCS_CONVERT, tenha em mente que esse m√©todo talvez n√£o esteja presente em vers√µes mais antigas, caso seja o seu caso, um work-around seria so copiar o m√©todo de um ambiente mais atualizado...

CL_BCS_CONVERT=>STRING_TO_SOLIX( exporting IV_STRING = IV_TOSIGN
								 importing EV_SIZE = LV_BINSIZE
										   ET_SOLIX = LT_TOSIGN_BIN ).

Nesse caso, IV_TO_SIGN representa nossa vari√°vel com o {headers_base64}.{payload_base64}, LV_BIN_SIZE vamos passar no par√¢metro OSTR_INPUT_DATA_L, e LT_TOSIGN_BIN vai ser o par√¢metro OSTR_INPUT_DATA. Tendo isso, temos tudo o que precisa para realizar a assinatura, sendo assim chamamos a fun√ß√£o.

call function 'SSF_KRN_SIGN'
  exporting  SSFTOOLKIT                   = 'SAPSECULIB'
             STR_FORMAT                   = 'PKCS1-V1.5'
             B_INC_CERTS                  = 'X'
             B_DETACHED                   = ''
             B_INENC                      = ''
             OSTR_INPUT_DATA_L            = IV_FILESIZE
             STR_HASHALG                  = 'SHA256'
  importing  OSTR_SIGNED_DATA_L           = LV_SIGNED_DATA_L
             CRC                          = LV_SIG_CRC
  tables     OSTR_INPUT_DATA              = LT_SIG_OSTR_INPUT_DATA
             SIGNER                       = LT_SIG_SIGNER
             OSTR_SIGNED_DATA             = LT_SIGNED_BIN
  exceptions others                       = 11

A fun√ß√£o ira retornar o conte√∫do assinado em bin√°rio (SOLIX), podemos converter ela para uma XSTRING e depois para string utilizando os m√©todos da classe CL_BCS_CONVERT. De acordo com o manual do Bradesco, tendo a assinatura em bin√°rio em m√£os, devemos criptografar em Base64assim utilizando os m√©todos anteriores que utilizamos no come√ßo do processo, ENCODE_BASE64 da classe CL_HTTP_UTILITY.

Tendo a vari√°vel de conte√∫do para assinar mais a vari√°vel com a assinatura, juntamos as duas concatenadas separadas por um ., essa vai ser nossa vari√°vel de payload. Devemos novamente aplicar um filtro na codifica√ß√£o Base64 para remover os "restinhos" da string, exemplo:

concatenate LV_TOSIGN LV_SIGNED into LV_PAYLOAD separated by '.'.

replace all occurences of 'AAAAA' in LV_PAYLOAD with ''.
replace all occurences of '==' in LV_PAYLOAD with ''.
replace all occurences of 'A=' in LV_PAYLOAD with ''.
replace all occurences of '+' in LV_PAYLOAD with '-'.
replace all occurences of '/' in LV_PAYLOAD with '_'.

E depois de tanto esfor√ßo, temos o nosso conte√∫do de payload pronto para ser enviado para a API, esse processo era utilizado para cada requisi√ß√£o na API do Bradesco, nesse caso mostrei como faz para a autentica√ß√£o, mas segue com as mesmas ferramentas para as demais requisi√ß√µes.

Caso tenha uma d√∫vida s√≥ deixar um coment√°rio, vejo voc√™s no SIT JLLE üòÑ 
SIT Joinville 2026

entry.title: Re: Question about Higher-Level Item Linking in Service O...
entry.content:
Hi Julius,

This is not solving my issue here is the requirement:

I‚Äôm facing an issue with how materials are distributed between service call and activity levels in FSM.

Here is the setup:

  • Bundle 1 contains:

    • Operation 1 (HRE)

    • Spare Part 1

    • Spare Part 2

  • Bundle 2 contains:

    • Operation 2 (HRE)

    • Spare Part 3

When I release the order, FSM correctly creates one Service Call with two Activities:

  • Activity 1: Operation 1 (HRE)

  • Activity 2: Operation 2 (HRE)

However, all the spare parts (Spare Parts 1, 2, and 3) are appearing at the Service Call level, not at the corresponding Activity level.
As a result, the technician performing Operation 1 can see all parts (1, 2, and 3), but it‚Äôs unclear which materials belong to which activity.

Question / Requirement:
I would like to have the spare parts assigned to their related activity in FSM (i.e., Spare Parts 1 & 2 for Activity 1, and Spare Part 3 for Activity 2).

I tried using the Higher-Level Item relationship in SAP, but encountered issues:

  • If I leave the service bundle without a higher-level item, I get an error message saying it cannot be empty.

  • If I assign the operation as the higher-level item, SAP automatically changes the item category of the spare parts and then I receive an error message.

Could you please advise:

  1. Is it possible to have materials appear at the activity level in FSM instead of the service call level?

  2. If yes, what is the correct way to configure the higher-level item relationship (or any other setting) to achieve this?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,

entry.content:
H,

I‚Äôm facing an issue with how materials are distributed between service call and activity levels in FSM.

Here is the setup:

Bundle 1 contains:

Operation 1 (HRE)

Spare Part 1

Spare Part 2

Bundle 2 contains:

Operation 2 (HRE)

Spare Part 3

When I release the order, FSM correctly creates one Service Call with two Activities:

Activity 1: Operation 1 (HRE)

Activity 2: Operation 2 (HRE)

However, all the spare parts (Spare Parts 1, 2, and 3) are appearing at the Service Call level, not at the corresponding Activity level.
As a result, the technician performing Operation 1 can see all parts (1, 2, and 3), but it‚Äôs unclear which materials belong to which activity.

Question / Requirement:
I would like to have the spare parts assigned to their related activity in FSM (i.e., Spare Parts 1 & 2 for Activity 1, and Spare Part 3 for Activity 2).

I tried using the Higher-Level Item relationship in SAP, but encountered issues:

If I leave the service bundle without a higher-level item, I get an error message saying it cannot be empty.

If I assign the operation as the higher-level item, SAP automatically changes the item category of the spare parts and then I receive an error message.

Could you please advise:

Is it possible to have materials appear at the activity level in FSM instead of the service call level?

If yes, what is the correct way to configure the higher-level item relationship (or any other setting) to achieve this?

Thank you for your help.

Best regards,

entry.title: Duplicate line PO ME22N Script VBA
entry.content:
Dear all, I request your support with the following:

When we receive a partial shipment from the supplier, we usually update the PO in SAP by duplicating the product line item, adding the quantity delivered in the new line item, and the rest in the original line item.
I'm developing a VBA/Excel script to do this. I'd like to know how I can access the index (number) of the newly created row, so I can assign the quantity delivered and use it in my reports.
Here's my code:
Initially, I thought I'd count the rows in the table and use it as the index for the new row; the number of rows is greater than the number of items in the PO.

Sub dividir_lineasSAP()

Dim SapGuiAuto As Object
Dim SAPApp As Object
Dim SAPCon As Object
Dim SAPSession As Object
Dim tbl_me22n As Object
Dim po As String
Dim linea As Integer

' === Conectar a SAP ===
On Error Resume Next
Set SapGuiAuto = GetObject("SAPGUI")
Set SAPApp = SapGuiAuto.GetScriptingEngine
Set SAPCon = SAPApp.Children(0)
Set SAPSession = SAPCon.Children(0)
On Error GoTo 0

If SAPSession Is Nothing Then
MsgBox "SAP no est√° abierto o la sesi√≥n no est√° activa.", vbCritical
Exit Sub
End If

po = vpo 'orden de compra
linea = (vlinea / 10) - 1 'fila original en entorno SAP
q_ini = vcant 'cantidad original
q_fin = q_ini - Me.cant_po 'cantidad restante


With SAPSession

'Abrir ME22N
.findById("wnd[0]").maximize
.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/okcd").Text = "me22n"
.findById("wnd[0]").sendVKey 0

'Cargar PO
.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[1]/btn[17]").press
.findById("wnd[1]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0003/ctxtMEPO_SELECT-EBELN").Text = po
.findById("wnd[1]").sendVKey 0

filasReales = 0

'Capturar tabla
Set tbl_me22n = SAPSession.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/tblSAPLMEGUITC_1211")
n_linea = tbl_me22n.RowCount


'Seleccionar y modificar cantidad de l√≠nea original
.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/tblSAPLMEGUITC_1211").getAbsoluteRow(linea).Selected = True
.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/tblSAPLMEGUITC_1211/txtMEPO1211-MENGE[6," & linea & "]").Text = q_fin

'Copiar l√≠nea original
.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/btnITEMCOPY").press

'Esperar
Application.Wait (Now + TimeValue("0:00:01"))

'Modificar cantidad en nueva l√≠nea
.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/tblSAPLMEGUITC_1211").getAbsoluteRow(n_linea).Selected = False
.findById("wnd[0]/usr/subSUB0:SAPLMEGUI:0016/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1100/subSUB2:SAPLMEVIEWS:1200/subSUB1:SAPLMEGUI:1211/tblSAPLMEGUITC_1211/txtMEPO1211-MENGE[6," & n_linea & "]").Text = vcant
.findById("wnd[0]/tbar[0]/btn[11]").press
.findById("wnd[1]/usr/btnSPOP-VAROPTION1").press

End With

entry.title: Leveraging Web Client Procedures for Use of LLMs within HDLRE
entry.content:
Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing data management systems with their advanced semantic understanding and exceptional generalization capabilities. In this article we will explain how to leverage existing web client procedure support in SAP HANA Cloud, data lake Relational Engine (HDLRE) to integrate LLMs. With this feature, customers can now harness the power of LLMs for enhanced database management and analytics. 

 SAP AI Core, a service within the SAP Business Technology Platform, is designed to manage the execution and operations of AI assets in a standardized and scalable manner. While this article primarily focuses on SAP AI Core as the LLM service, please note that the feature is highly adaptable and can be integrated with any LLM service that best meets your requirements. 

 To deploy an LLM model within SAP AI Core, follow the instructions provided at‚ÄØinitial setup for SAP AI core service‚ÄØto enable the service, generate a service key, and obtain an access token. Subsequently, you can deploy a language model, such as GPT-5 or Cloud Sonnet 4, and retrieve the deployment URL. Detailed instructions for this process are available at‚ÄØcreate deployment for generative AI model in SAP AI core.‚ÄØ 

 In HDLRE, you can create a user-defined web client procedure to make HTTP requests to an HTTP server. This procedure will be used to invoke LLM services. For a more detailed explanation, please refer to the‚ÄØdocumentation to create a procedure (web service).‚ÄØ 

 In our example, we have developed a web client procedure named AIPOST to make AI API calls. Ensure that the API version is specified according to the relevant AI API documentation. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE AIPOST ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ data LONG VARCHAR 

) 

RESULT(c1 long varchar, c2 long varchar)‚ÄØ 

URL ‚Äò$YOUR_DEPLOYMENT_URL/chat/completions?$API_VERSION' 

TYPE 'HTTP:POST:application/json' 

HEADER 'Authorization:Bearer $YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN' 

SET 'HTTP(VERSION=1.1)';

To call the procedure for an introduction to SAP HDLRE, use the following example: 

CALL AIPOST('{ "messages": [ { "role": "user", "content": "What is SAP HDLRE" } ] }');

 Building on this, more advanced and practical stored procedures can be developed to leverage LLMs effectively. For instance, if we have an expense table, with some potentially suspicious round numbers( for testing), ‚ÄØ‚ÄØwe can employ AI to detect any irregular data patterns that may indicate potential fraud. In this procedure, we will gather all data from the expense table and submit it, along with a query, to the LLM service. 

Please be advised that the stored procedure sp_parse_json will be available in HDLRE version QRC4/2025. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_fraud_detection( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @expense_data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF user_question LIKE '%detection%' OR user_question LIKE '%fraud%' THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'expense' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT 'All Expense Records: ' +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØLIST('ID:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_id, 0) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Desc:' + ISNULL(expense_description, 'N/A') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Amount:' + CAST(ISNULL(amount, 0) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Date:' + CAST(ISNULL(expense_date, TODAY()) AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Category:' + ISNULL(category, 'N/A'),‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ' || ') 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ INTO @expense_data 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT expense_id, expense_description, amount, expense_date, category 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM expense 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ORDER BY expense_date DESC 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ) AS recent_expenses; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ELSE 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @expense_data = 'Expense table not found in database'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + @expense_data + ']', 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

   

   -- Parse the JSON and extract the content 

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_fraud_detection('Can you detect any fraud in the expenses table, apply Benford law if needed');

Once the response is parsed from its JSON format, we obtain the analysis from the LLM service. Initially, it explains Benford‚Äôs law, and then identifies the dataset as suspicious, and offers recommendations. 

Here is another example of leveraging AI to redact sensitive personal data and generate an alternative treatment plan for patients. Similar to the previous example, this stored procedure retrieves data from the patient_records table and sends it to the LLM service. 

CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE ask_ai_redact( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IN user_question LONG VARCHAR 

) 

BEGIN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _payload LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _data LONG VARCHAR DEFAULT ''; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE _response LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ DECLARE @clean_question LONG VARCHAR; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Get medical data from the specified table 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ IF EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM SYSTABLE WHERE table_name = 'patient_records' AND table_type = 'BASE') THEN 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build medical data string with all patient information 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØSELECT 'Medical Records Data: ' +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØLIST('Record_' + CAST(record_id AS VARCHAR) +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Name:' + ISNULL(patient_name, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|DOB:' + ISNULL(CAST(birth_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Gender:' + ISNULL(gender, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Phone:' + ISNULL(phone_number, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Email:' + ISNULL(email_address, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Address:' + ISNULL(street_address, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(city_name, '') + ', ' + ISNULL(province_code, '') + ' ' + ISNULL(postal_code, '') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|SIN:' + ISNULL(sin, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|OHIP:' + ISNULL(ohip_number, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Diagnosis:' + ISNULL(CAST(diagnosis_description AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Treatment:' + ISNULL(CAST(treatment_notes AS VARCHAR(100)), 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|Doctor:' + ISNULL(doctor_name, 'Unknown') +‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '|VisitDate:' + ISNULL(CAST(visit_date AS VARCHAR), 'Unknown') + 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ' || ') 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ INTO _data 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM ( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT * FROM patient_records ORDER BY record_id 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ) AS sample_records; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ELSE 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _data = 'No medical records table found'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ END IF; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Clean the user question for JSON (escape quotes and newlines) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET @clean_question = REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE( 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ user_question + ' [Database Context: ' + _data + ']', 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ '"', '\\"'), CHAR(10), '\\n'), CHAR(13), '\\r'), CHAR(9), '\\t'); 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ -- Build complete JSON payload directly 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SET _payload = '{"messages":[{"role":"user","content":"' + @clean_question + '"}]}'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ SELECT c2 INTO _response 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ FROM (AIPOST(@json_payload)) 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ WHERE c1 LIKE '%Body%'; 

‚ÄØ ‚ÄØ  

    -- Parse the JSON and extract the content  

   CALL sp_parse_json('ai_parsed', _response); 

 

   -- Display the response 
   SELECT ai_parsed.choices[[1]].[message].[content]; 
 

END; 

 

call ask_ai_redact('Replace sensitive personal data with placeholder values like [REDACTED_NAME]. Return the redacted data in the same format. Also provide an alternative treatment plan for each patient.');

The response confirms that all sensitive data has been redacted, and a recommended treatment plan is provided. 

Additionally, we can develop auxiliary stored procedures to simulate context windows, preserving chat history like chat-based AI models like ChatGPT. We can also create procedures that leverage LLMs for data usage predictions, schema analysis, and more. This feature allows us to fully capitalize on the immense potential of both the database and the LLMs. We hope you find this feature valuable and enjoy the numerous opportunities it brings for enhanced database management and analytics!

entry.title: Re: Unlocking Efficiency: The Power of PLM System Integration (PLMSI) by SAP
entry.content:

entry.title: Multiple business place not allowed in same reporting entity India GSTR statutory reporting
entry.content:
While executing India GSTR statutory report in SAP public cloud, facing issue with reporting multiple business place in single state.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Multiple business place not allowed in same reporting...
entry.content:
Dear all,

 

Please note that multiple business place is not allowed for same reporting entity for GSTR statutory report as per business requirement in statutory reporting.

 

Reporting entity: Reporting entity is a legal entity within your organization which is doing reporting. A reporting entity has one or more organization units. The organization units can be business place, company code etc.

 

Kindly refer the below help document on India GSTR reports available for statutory reporting,

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/634261119fec4d58970471f2c4a9a740/b9524d0554714ab6b0dacc8866c0fac9.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud
